Articles.Content:
Hey!

I\'m a veteran around here, but never posted a craft of my own!

This here\'s a Concorde-esque plane that requires only three steps to fly - Hold shift, press T, and hit the spacebar! That\'s right - it literally flies itself, including takeoff!

I know 'no pics, no clicks' is a pretty big rule around here, but I\'ll have those puppies up soon. For now, enjoy this plane and toy with it - if you get an improvement, lemme know.

Cheers!
Screw pictures I downloaded it any ways. Will test it after my current mun flight going on.
I really like this plane! My first test I did exactly what the instructions and it went about 80,000 meters total.
Dang this thing does fly without you!

It does fly unassisted as advertized - Until you stop the engines for landing, at which point even with SAS on the nose pitches completely upwards and it sinks like a rock. Other than that, it\'s a nice plane.

It does fly unassisted as advertized - Until you stop the engines for landing, at which point even with SAS on the nose pitches completely upwards and it sinks like a rock. Other than that, it\'s a nice plane.

Yeah, I\'ve only managed to land it going downhill and with butt-tons of luck. If someone can figure a way to make it land better, I\'ll give \'em a virtual high-five!

Now, Cooly, can I use that image to show how the Concorde flies?
